content: fluff by stitchnerd designs yarn choice designed for lace-weight mohair one yarn version 200m 220 yds for a small version up to 400m 440 yds for a large version two yarn version the second yarn can be fingering weight 100m 110 yds of each for a small version 200m 220 yds of each for a large version tip using pointy needles makes it easier to work with this type of yarn stitchnerd rowan kidsilk haze stripe on 5mm us 8 gauge isn t critical but may affect yarn requirements the tighter you knit the more yarn you ll use the knit should be loose and lofty - this lets the mohair really fluff up needle size and yarn choice a needle size that will produce a texture you like i have average gauge and used 5mm us 8 needles if you knit tightly maybe try one size larger or if you knit loosely try one size smaller i used 6mm us 10 for the bind-off worked loosely for more ideas you can take abbreviations a look at the fluff projects linked to the k knit pattern on ravelry - or join kfb knit into the front and back loops of the stitch us in the stitchnerds group makes 1 new stitch k2tog knit 2 together decreases one stitch and don t forget to post pics sl pw slip_stitch purlwise of yours so we can see how wyif with the yarn at the front of the knitting as you work rs/ws right side/wrong side your yarn works with the pattern tips weave the ends in neatly and you ll be able to wear both sides as the right side if you have to join yarn don t do it right at the edge - this creates a lump - join about 5 stitches from the edge © susan ashcroft 2013 - for personal non-commercial use only fluff 2 edges can make a difference keep your edges neat and even and the scarf will not require any extra finishing be sure not to stretch the stitches too much as you work the k2tog when slipping stitches at the edges keep the edge firm by tensioning the 2nd and 3rd stitches as you are knitting the k2tog edge will be slightly looser than the edge with the kfb/kfb and the scarf will curve in this is normal and helps to create the boomerang shape - the photo shows a different shawl but the shape will be the same making the scarf cast on 8 stitches you might like to think about which end of the yarn to start with if your yarn has stripes it s best to start at least half way through a stripe or that colour will dominate on the narrow end i recommend cable cast on worked between the stitches because it will match the other edges blog link for cable cast-on http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html row 1 rs kfb knit to last 2 stitches k2tog row 2
